intro: Hermione sublutea, commonly known as the golden twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a small, herbaceous plant with a distinctive appearance, featuring a slender stem and a single, showy flower. The flower has a pale yellow coloration, which gives the plant its common name, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and grassy areas. It is known for its unique morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
